sentences.sContent: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.sCn: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.sContent: Marty’s very particular about his food.
...You may have heard that coca-cola once contained an ingredient capable of sparking particular devors: cocaine...
...Most agree that the solution is to push doctors to accept fixed payments to care for a particular illness or for a patient's needs over a year...

...allows schools to fill their classes with qualified students; it allows admissions committees to select the students that are in particular demand for their college and know those students will come...
...the new guidelines being developed could result in doctors choosing one drug over another for cost reasons or even deciding that a particular treatment-at the end of life...
...If the CFL should be used for lighting a particular space...
...This particular fellow has been in prison before...
...Reinforcement occurs when we receive direct or indirect rewards or punishments for particular gender role behaviors...
...Boys in particular look at the other questions and say...
...That may mean a lot to that particular kid...
...by gauging the reactions to our self-disclosures we learn what types are acceptable or unacceptable with particular people and in specific situations...

synos.tran: 特别的；详细的；独有的；挑剔的

phrases.pCn: 过分讲究的；难以取悦的
在一切方面；每一项；每一点

words.tran: 特别地，独特地；详细地，具体地；明确地，细致地
特殊神宠论；完全忠于一种理论

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize that you are referring to one individual person, thing or type of thing and not others
